snippet: One L. Goh was battling debt and had dropped out of Oikos University, where seven people were shot to death on Monday.
abstract: Korean-American One L Goh, accused shooter in deaths of seven people, was battling debt and had dropped out of Oikos University in Oakland, Calif, where killings took place; shooting, which also wounded three others, has shaken Korean-Americans in the area; search is underway for gun that Goh tossed into an estuary before he surrendered.

byline.original: By NORIMITSU ONISHI and MALIA WOLLAN
byline.contributor: Timothy Williams and Emma G. Fitzsimmons contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: One L. Goh was battling debt and had dropped out of Oikos University, where seven people were shot to death on Monday.

headline.seo: Troubled History Emerges for Suspect in Oakland Shootings
headline.main: Troubled History Emerges for Suspect in Fatal Oakland Attack
headline.print_headline: Troubled History Emerges For Suspect in Fatal Attack
